title: OpenTelemetry Semantic Convention Schema
description: YAML schema for semantic convention generator, use for example with VS Code.

anyOf.title: Semantic Convention
anyOf.description: A semantic convention that is neither a span nor an event semantic convention

metrics.title: Metrics
metrics.description: list of imported metric semantic convention IDs

items.title: Metric ID
items.description: ID of the imported metric semantic convention

events.title: Events
events.description: list of imported event semantic convention IDs

items.title: Event ID
items.description: ID of the imported event semantic convention

entities.title: Entities
entities.description: list of imported entity semantic convention IDs

items.title: Entity ID
items.description: ID of the imported entity semantic convention

$defs.title: OpenTelemetry Semantic Convention Schema Definitions
$defs.description: YAML schema definitions for semantic convention generator, use for example with VS Code.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: additional annotations for the telemetry object

Deprecated.title: Deprecated
Deprecated.description: Specifies if an attribute or a signal is deprecated.

oneOf.title: Deprecated - Renamed
oneOf.description: The telemetry object containing the deprecated field has been renamed to an existing or a new telemetry object.

reason.title: Renamed
reason.description: The telemetry object containing the deprecated field has been renamed to an existing or a new telemetry object.

renamed_to.title: Renamed To
renamed_to.description: The new name of the telemetry object.

note:.title: Note
note:.description: A note explaining the reason for the deprecation.

oneOf.title: Deprecated - Obsoleted
oneOf.description: The telemetry object containing the deprecated field has been obsoleted because it no longer exists and has no valid replacement.

reason.title: Obsoleted
reason.description: The telemetry object containing the deprecated field has been obsoleted because it no longer exists and has no valid replacement.

note:.title: Note
note:.description: A note explaining the reason for the deprecation.

oneOf.title: Deprecated - Uncategorized
oneOf.description: The telemetry object containing the deprecated field has been deprecated for complex reasons (split, merge, ...) which are currently not precisely defined in the supported deprecation reasons.

reason.title: Uncategorized
reason.description: The telemetry object containing the deprecated field has been deprecated for complex reasons (split, merge, ...) which are currently not precisely defined in the supported deprecation reasons.

note:.title: Note
note:.description: A note explaining the reason for the deprecation.

allOf.title: Not Metric or Event
allOf.description: The (signal) type of the semantic convention is neither 'metric' nor 'event'. Therefore, it MUST contain either an 'attributes' or an 'extends' field.

if.title: Not Metric or Event
if.description: The (signal) type of the semantic convention is neither 'metric' nor 'event'.

type.title: Not Metric or Event
type.description: The (signal) type of the semantic convention is neither 'metric' nor 'event'.

not.title: Not Metric or Event
not.description: The (signal) type of the semantic convention is neither 'metric' nor 'event'.

then.title: Not Metric or Event - Then
then.description: The (signal) type of the semantic convention is neither 'metric' nor 'event'. Therefore, it MUST contain either an 'attributes' or an 'extends' field.

anyOf.title: Attributes Required
anyOf.description: The (signal) type of the semantic convention is neither 'metric' nor 'event'. Therefore, it MUST contain either an 'attributes' or an 'extends' field.

anyOf.title: Extends Required
anyOf.description: The (signal) type of the semantic convention is neither 'metric' nor 'event'. Therefore, it MUST contain either an 'attributes' or an 'extends' field.

allOf.title: Not Attribute Group
allOf.description: The (signal) type of the semantic convention is not 'attribute_group'. Therefore, it MUST contain a 'stability' field.

if.title: Not Attribute Group
if.description: The (signal) type of the semantic convention is not 'attribute_group'.

type.title: Not Attribute Group
type.description: The (signal) type of the semantic convention is not 'attribute_group'.

not.title: Not Attribute Group
not.description: The (signal) type of the semantic convention is not 'attribute_group'.

then.title: Not Attribute Group - Then
then.description: The (signal) type of the semantic convention is not 'attribute_group'. Therefore, it MUST contain a 'stability' field.

type.title: Type
type.description: The (signal) type of the semantic convention

brief.title: Brief
brief.description: a brief description of the semantic convention

note.title: Note
note.description: a more elaborate description of the semantic convention. It defaults to an empty string

extends.title: Extends
extends.description: reference another semantic convention ID. It inherits all attributes from the specified semantic convention.

attributes.title: Attributes
attributes.description: list of attributes that belong to the semantic convention

display_name.title: Display Name
display_name.description: the display name / title of the semantic convention.

span_kind.title: Span Kind
span_kind.description: specifies the kind of the span.

anyOf.title: General Requirement
anyOf.description: The event semantic convention MUST contain a 'name' field.

AnyValueSemanticConvention.title: Any Value
AnyValueSemanticConvention.description: An any value of a semantic convention

brief.title: Brief
brief.description: a brief description of the value.

note.title: Note
note.description: a more elaborate description of the value. It defaults to an empty string.

requirement_level.title: Requirement Level
requirement_level.description: specifies the any value requirement level. Can be 'required', 'conditionally_required', 'recommended', or 'opt_in'. When omitted, the value is 'recommended'. When set to 'conditionally_required', the string provided MUST specify the conditions under which the value is required.

oneOf.title: Conditionally Required
oneOf.description: The any value is conditionally required. The string provided MUST specify the conditions under which the value is required.

conditionally_required.title: Condition
conditionally_required.description: the conditions under which the value is required.

oneOf.title: Recommended with Note
oneOf.description: The any value is recommended. The string provided MUST specify additional notes about the recommendation.

recommended.title: Condition
recommended.description: the conditions under which the value is required.

oneOf.title: Opt-In with Note
oneOf.description: The any value is opt-in. The string provided MUST specify additional notes about the opt-in.

opt_in.title: Condition
opt_in.description: the conditions under which the value is required.

examples.title: Examples
examples.description: sequence/dictionary of example values. They are optional for boolean, int, double, and enum attributes. Example values must be of the same type as the value. If only a single example is provided, it can directly be reported without encapsulating it into a sequence/dictionary.

fields.title: Fields
fields.description: when the type is map, this identifies the child (nested) any values associated with the map.

members.title: Members
members.description: when the type is enum, this identifies the enum members.

items.title: Enum Member
items.description: An enum member of an attribute

value.title: Value
value.description: string or number, value of the enum entry.

brief.title: Brief
brief.description: brief description of the enum entry value. It defaults to the value of ID.

note.title: Note
note.description: longer description. It defaults to an empty string.

instrument.title: Instrument
instrument.description: The instrument used to record the metric.

unit.title: Unit
unit.description: The unit in which the metric is measured in.

SemanticConvention.title: Semantic Convention
SemanticConvention.description: A semantic convention that is neither a span nor an event semantic convention

type.title: Type
type.description: The (signal) type of the semantic convention

not.title: Not Span, or Event
not.description: The (signal) type of the semantic convention cannot be 'span', or 'event' for this definition.

AttributeEnumType.title: Attribute Enum Type
AttributeEnumType.description: specifies an enumerated type for an attribute

items.title: Enum Member
items.description: An enum member of an attribute

value.title: Value
value.description: string or number, value of the enum entry.

brief.title: Brief
brief.description: brief description of the enum entry value. It defaults to the value of ID.

note.title: Note
note.description: longer description. It defaults to an empty string.

tag.title: Tag
tag.description: associates a tag to the attribute

Attribute.title: Attribute
Attribute.description: An attribute of a semantic convention

requirement_level.title: Requirement Level
requirement_level.description: specifies the attribute requirement level. Can be 'required', 'conditionally_required', 'recommended', or 'opt_in'. When omitted, the attribute is 'recommended'. When set to 'conditionally_required', the string provided MUST specify the conditions under which the attribute is required.

oneOf.title: Conditionally Required
oneOf.description: The attribute is conditionally required. The string provided MUST specify the conditions under which the attribute is required.

conditionally_required.title: Condition
conditionally_required.description: the conditions under which the attribute is required.

oneOf.title: Recommended with Note
oneOf.description: The attribute is recommended. The string provided MUST specify additional notes about the recommendation.

sampling_relevant.title: Sampling Relevant
sampling_relevant.description: specifies if it is relevant for sampling. It defaults to false.

note.title: Note
note.description: additional notes to the attribute. It defaults to an empty string.

examples.title: Examples
examples.description: sequence/dictionary of example values for the attribute. They are optional for boolean, int, double, and enum attributes. Example values must be of the same type of the attribute. If only a single example is provided, it can directly be reported without encapsulating it into a sequence/dictionary.

role.title: Attribute Role
role.description: specified the role of an attribute (e.g. descriptive or identifying).

allOf.title: Attribute Specification or Reference
allOf.description: Either a full specification of an attribute or a reference to an existing attribute

AttributeRole.title: Attribute Role
AttributeRole.description: specified the role of an attribute (e.g. descriptive or identifying).

AnyValueType.title: Any Value Type
AnyValueType.description: specifies the supported any value types.
